title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4080.4 - Registration and de-registration
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4080.4 - Registration and de-registration

State Regulations

No horse shall be considered as a New York-bred
thoroughbred unless such horse is so registered by the fund. Should the fund be
satisfied that grounds exist to cancel or void a registration it may so
determine and order any monies of the fund due any person as a result of such
questionable registration held, and if paid, to be returned to the fund for
proper disposition. In addition, pending such determination, the fund shall be
empowered to order retention of such monies as may be payable as a result of
any questionable registration, for proper disposition, upon its final
determination. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4080.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
